page.title: 12Toppesfield Congregat'al Ch.
page.content: Toppesfield Congregational Church was built in 1885 and seats 250 people. Before that date,worshippers met in a former woodshed to the rear which had been converted into a hall.The Church currently needs major repairs and services are once again being held in the old hall,which has been repaired and redecorated.The Church now has 11 members and 8 adherents (worshippers who have not accepted membership). Previously it had a joint pastorate with Stambourne Congregational Church but it is no longer strong enough to afford a minister and relies on lay preachers and visiting ministers to take services.When the Congregational Church in England and Wales united with the Presbyterian Church in 1972, the Toppesfield Church members voted to become an independent Church affil- iated to the Congregational Federation
